item.title: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“haviland4, post:28, topic:541529”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=660400.msg4415775#msg4415775 date=1395833840]
BankX2.java
user this:

int Xamount = c.getInStream().readDWord();
Add this:

System.out.println("Amount [" + Xamount + "]");// I just like my number in [ ] because it makes it so much easier to read

This will print out to the server’s command prompt or log area (what ever you want to call it) the Xamount variable, which is received from the client.
[/quote]

user this??? lol im so bad :rolleyes: what does user this mean?[/quote]

Use*

He wants you to print the variable to the console. Underneath

int Xamount = c.getInStream().readDWord();

Underneath that, print it

System.out.println("Amount: "+Xamount);

item.title: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

BankX2.java
user this:

int Xamount = c.getInStream().readDWord();
Add this:

System.out.println("Amount [" + Xamount + "]");// I just like my number in [ ] because it makes it so much easier to read

This will print out to the server’s command prompt or log area (what ever you want to call it) the Xamount variable, which is received from the client.

item.source: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*

item.title: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*
item.dc:creator: @haviland4 haviland4
item.description:
@haviland4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:25, topic:541529”]Doesn’t look like there’s anything wrong with the packets (aside from it not checking what interface is open).
Seems like the wrong data is being sent from the client.
Maybe add something to check what data the client is sending to the packet and make sure it’s the same as what they entered.

More questions:
Does the error only occur when using the bones on the specific altar? Try using the actual “Bank X” option in the bank and see if it throws the errors.
Does it only occur when the user enters a large number? Over the value of Integer.MAX_VALUE.[/quote]

Only bones on the specific altar

Seems like the wrong data is being sent from the client.
Maybe add something to check what data the client is sending to the packet and make sure it’s the same as what they entered.

how could i do this?

Read full topic
item.source: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*

item.title: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Doesn’t look like there’s anything wrong with the packets (aside from it not checking what interface is open).
Seems like the wrong data is being sent from the client.
Maybe add something to check what data the client is sending to the packet and make sure it’s the same as what they entered.

More questions:
Does the error only occur when using the bones on the specific altar? Try using the actual “Bank X” option in the bank and see if it throws the errors.
Does it only occur when the user enters a large number? Over the value of Integer.MAX_VALUE.

Read full topic

item.title: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*
item.dc:creator: @haviland4 haviland4
item.description:
@haviland4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:21, topic:541529”][quote author=haviland4 link=topic=660400.msg4415757#msg4415757 date=1395830532]

Are you using object ID 409? Because it’s the only one you’ve shown me that sends any form of packet to the client… And the others look like they should work fine. Like I said, consider using a new prayer base.

yeah im using object ID 409.

[/quote]
That would of helped. Last I knew that wasn’t a gilded altar so you were confusing me.

Are there any server sided errors when the player errors from this? Or are they just client.

Can I see BankX1.java and BankX2.java (they handle the packet you’re having an issue with)[/quote]

there are no server sided errors.

Bankx1.java

[code=java]package server.model.players.packets;

import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;
/**

  • Bank X Items
    **/
    public class BankX1 implements PacketType {

    public static final int PART1 = 135;
    public static final int PART2 = 208;
    public int XremoveSlot, XinterfaceID, XremoveID, Xamount;
    @Override
    public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
    if (packetType == 135) {
    if(c.storing) {

     		return;
 	}
 	c.xRemoveSlot = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndian();
 	c.xInterfaceId = c.getInStream().readUnsignedWordA();
 	c.xRemoveId = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndian();
 }
 if (c.xInterfaceId == 3900) {
 	c.getShops().buyItem(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, 200);//buy 200
 	c.xRemoveSlot = 0;
 	c.xInterfaceId = 0;
 	c.xRemoveId = 0;
 	return;
 }
 	if(c.storing) {
 		
 		return;
 	}

 if(packetType == PART1) {
 	synchronized(c) {
 	if(c.storing) {
 		
 		return;
 	}
 		c.getOutStream().createFrame(27);
 	}			
 }

    }
    }
    [/code]

Bankx2.java

package server.model.players.packets;

import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.shops.*;
import server.model.players.PacketType;
import server.Config;
import server.Server;
import server.model.items.GameItem;
import server.model.items.Item;
import server.util.Misc;

/**
 * Bank X Items Rewrote by Hack3r
 **/

public class BankX2 implements PacketType {
	@Override
	public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
		int Xamount = c.getInStream().readDWord();
		if(c.sellingId > 0 && c.sellingN > 0 && c.xInterfaceId == 7390){
			for (int i : Config.ITEM_TRADEABLE)  {
				if(i == c.sellingId) {
					c.sendMessage("You can't sell this item.");
					c.sellingId = 0;
					c.sellingN = 0;
					c.sellingS = 0;
					return;
				}		
			}
			if(c.sellingN > c.getItems().getItemAmount(c.sellingId))
				c.sellingN = c.getItems().getItemAmount(c.sellingId);
			int slot = -1;
			for(int x = 0; x < 10; x++){
				if(c.playerShop[x] == 0){
					slot = x;
					break;
				}
			}
			if(slot == -1){
				c.sendMessage("You can only be selling 10 items at once!");
				c.sellingId = 0;
				c.sellingN = 0;
				c.sellingS = 0;
				return;
			}
			if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.sellingId, c.sellingN, c.sellingS)){
				if (c.playerRights == 2 && Config.ADMIN_CAN_SELL_ITEMS == false && !c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("owner")) {
				c.sendMessage("Sorry, You're Selling rights are disabled.");
				return;
			}
				c.getItems().deleteItem2(c.sellingId, c.sellingN);
				c.playerShop[slot] = c.sellingId;
				c.playerShopN[slot] = c.sellingN;
				c.playerShopP[slot] = Xamount;
				c.sendMessage("You put your items on sale.");
				c.sendMessage("Check your items by typing ::myshop, collect your money with ::collect");
				c.sendMessage("Before collecting make sure you've got inventory space, or you wont get shit!");
			}
			c.getShops().openPlayerShop(c);
			c.sellingId = 0;
			c.sellingN = 0;
			c.sellingS = 0;
			return;
		}
		if (Xamount < 0)//Fix for duplication via xremove by h a c k 3 r
		{
			Xamount = c.getItems().getItemAmount(c.xRemoveId);
		}
		if (Xamount == 0) {
			Xamount = 1;
		}
		if(c.getGamble().betting) {
			c.getGamble().playerBet = Xamount;
			c.getGamble().blackJack(c);
		}
		switch (c.xInterfaceId) {
			case 5064:
			if(c.inTrade) {
				c.sendMessage("You can't store items while trading!");
				return;
			}
				
			case 5382:
			c.getItems().fromBank(c.bankItems[c.xRemoveSlot] , c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
			break;

			case 3322:
			if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
			return;
			if(c.duelStatus <= 0) {
            	c.getTradeAndDuel().tradeItem(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
            } else {				
				c.getTradeAndDuel().stakeItem(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
			}  
			break;
				
			case 3415: 
			if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
			return;
			if(c.duelStatus <= 0) { 
            	c.getTradeAndDuel().fromTrade(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
			} 
			break;
				
			case 6669:
			if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.xRemoveId, Xamount))
			return;
			c.getTradeAndDuel().fromDuel(c.xRemoveId, c.xRemoveSlot, Xamount);
			break;			
		}
                if(c.usingAltar==true)
		        c.getPrayer().bonesOnAltar2(c.altarItemId, Xamount);
	}
}

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“haviland4, post:16, topic:541529”]ok so you want me to replace the current one in prayer.java

with

    public void bonesOnAltar(int id) {
            try {
                    c.getItems().deleteItem(id, c.getItems().getItemSlot(id), 1);
                    c.sendMessage("The gods are pleased with your offering.");
                    c.getPA().addSkillXP(getExp(id)*2*Config.PRAYER_EXPERIENCE, 5);
            } catch(Exception e) {
                    c.sendMessage("Something didn't go right...");
            }
    }[/quote]

Yes. Re-read my last post. Something went wrong when I posted, I fixed it (at least it looks fixed on mine)

item.source: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*

item.title: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“haviland4, post:14, topic:541529”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=660400.msg4415675#msg4415675 date=1395788820]
c.getPrayer().bonesOnHouseAltar(itemId);
c.getPrayer().bonesOnAltar(itemId);
Can I see these 2 methods? they’re in Prayer.java

Also, I’m not a fan of how your system works (at all). I wrote one up recently, it’s in the snippets. You should consider it. It isn’t the best. But it’s far better than what you have.
[/quote]

do you think if i uploaded these files you would be able to add the snippet or fix the disconneting for me??

public void bonesOnAltar(int id) { c.getItems().deleteItem(id, c.getItems().getItemSlot(id), 1); c.sendMessage("The gods are pleased with your offering."); c.getPA().addSkillXP(getExp(id)*2*Config.PRAYER_EXPERIENCE, 5); } public void bonesOnHouseAltar(int id) { if(c.COLectt > 3) { c.getItems().deleteItem(id, c.getItems().getItemSlot(id), 1); c.sendMessage("The gods are pleased with your offering."); c.sendMessage("You receive more XP from you're lecterns."); c.getPA().addSkillXP(getExp(id)*2*Config.PRAYER_EXPERIENCEINHOUSE, 5); } else { c.sendMessage("You need to have Lecterns built to do this."); } }[/quote]
No, because me fixing it for you wouldn’t teach you anything.

In both your methods (this is just a quick fix to stop the disconnecting) you’re going to want to add a try and catch.

public void bonesOnAltar(int id) { try { c.getItems().deleteItem(id, c.getItems().getItemSlot(id), 1); c.sendMessage("The gods are pleased with your offering."); c.getPA().addSkillXP(getExp(id)*2*Config.PRAYER_EXPERIENCE, 5); } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Something didn't go right..."); } }
I’ve done one for you as an example. You can try the next.

And are you sure it’s on the gilded altar that’s causing issues?
Because the only one I see that would send the option to input how many you want to use is 409 (I believe that’s a chaos altar or some shit).

Read full topic
item.source: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*

item.title: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*
item.dc:creator: @haviland4 haviland4
item.description:
@haviland4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:13, topic:541529”]c.getPrayer().bonesOnHouseAltar(itemId);
c.getPrayer().bonesOnAltar(itemId);
Can I see these 2 methods? they’re in Prayer.java

Also, I’m not a fan of how your system works (at all). I wrote one up recently, it’s in the snippets. You should consider it. It isn’t the best. But it’s far better than what you have.[/quote]

do you think if i uploaded these files you would be able to add the snippet or fix the disconneting for me??

public void bonesOnAltar(int id) { c.getItems().deleteItem(id, c.getItems().getItemSlot(id), 1); c.sendMessage("The gods are pleased with your offering."); c.getPA().addSkillXP(getExp(id)*2*Config.PRAYER_EXPERIENCE, 5); } public void bonesOnHouseAltar(int id) { if(c.COLectt > 3) { c.getItems().deleteItem(id, c.getItems().getItemSlot(id), 1); c.sendMessage("The gods are pleased with your offering."); c.sendMessage("You receive more XP from you're lecterns."); c.getPA().addSkillXP(getExp(id)*2*Config.PRAYER_EXPERIENCEINHOUSE, 5); } else { c.sendMessage("You need to have Lecterns built to do this."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*
item.dc:creator: @haviland4 haviland4
item.description:
@haviland4 wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Okay you’re going to want itemOnObject, it’s in UseItem.java (Should be)

[code]case 13191:
if (c.getPrayer().isBone(itemId))
c.getPrayer().bonesOnHouseAltar(itemId);
break;
case 409:
if (c.getPrayer().isBone(itemId) && c.usingAltar==false) {
c.usingAltar=true;
c.altarItemId=itemId;
c.getOutStream().createFrame(27);
}
break;
/*case 409:

			if (c.getPrayer().isBone(itemId))
				c.getPrayer().bonesOnAltar(itemId);
		break;*/
	default:
		if(c.playerRights == 3)
			Misc.println("Player At Object id: "+objectID+" with Item id: "+itemId);
		break;
	}
	
}[/code]

found this.

case 409: case 13191: if(c.playerLevel[5] < c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[5])) { c.startAnimation(645); c.playerLevel[5] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[5]); c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[5]); c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.sendMessage("You recharge your prayer points & HP..."); c.getPA().refreshSkill(5); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); } else { c.sendMessage("You already have full prayer points."); }

item.source: Bones on Gilded Altar Disconneting Problem *Solved*
